newsitem.title: USA: Microleague Multimedia to buy Micro Sports.
newsitem.headline: Microleague Multimedia to buy Micro Sports.

text.p: Microleague Multimedia Inc said on Monday it signed a letter of intent to buy Tennessee-based Micro Sports Inc in a stock swap valued at $2 million.
Microleague said in a statement it would exchange about 300,000 shares of its common stock for Micro Sports, which develops sport simulation software games.
Microleague Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Neil Swartz said the transaction demonstrated the ongoing consolidation in the software industry.
As a result of the acquisition, Microleague said it would delay the introduction of its Sports Illustrated Presents MicroLeague Baseball 6.0 until the start of the 1997 baseball season.

"We are taking advantage of the opportunity to enhance this product through the skills of the Micro Sports programming staff,and the marketing energy that comes with the start of a new baseball season," Swartz said.
Microleague also said it intended to release a professional football and college football game this year.
Micro Sports developed Micro Sports NFL Pro Football and Micro Sports Pro League Baseball.
